title: Economic Theories
description: Test your understanding of major economic theories and the thinkers behind them

questions.question: Which economist wrote 'The Wealth of Nations' in 1776, often considered the foundation of modern economics?
What does the economic concept of 'supply and demand' primarily determine?
Keynesian economics advocates for what during economic downturns?
options: Increased government spending to stimulate demand

questions.question: Which economic theory, associated with Milton Friedman, emphasizes controlling the money supply?
What is 'laissez-faire' economics?
options: Minimal government interference in the economy

questions.question: Karl Marx co-authored which famous economic and political pamphlet in 1848?
The concept of 'comparative advantage' in international trade was developed by which economist?
What is inflation?
options: A rise in the stock market
A general increase in prices over time

questions.question: Which economic concept describes the idea that people respond to incentives?
The 'invisible hand' is a metaphor coined by Adam Smith referring to what?
What economic system features government ownership of the means of production?
The 'Laffer Curve' illustrates the relationship between tax rates and what?
Which economist won the Nobel Prize and was known for his work on free markets and the Chicago School?
What is a 'mixed economy'?
options: An economy that combines private enterprise with government regulation
An economy based solely on agriculture
An economy that only trades with neighboring countries
